block.p: A Burmese water festival on Sunday from 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. at the Queens Botanical Garden, 43-50 Main Street in Flushing, will feature dishes like lemon grass seafood soup, chicken curry and vegetables with rice noodles. The festival is free; the food is $1 to $4.

A lecture about cheese, with a tasting, will be given by Steven Jenkins, Fairway's cheese buyer, at the store, 2127 Broadway (74th Street), next Wednesday from 7:30 to 9 p.m. The fee is $40. Reservations: (212) 595-1888.

A Burmese water festival on Sunday from 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. at the Queens Botanical Garden, 43-50 Main Street in Flushing, will feature dishes like lemon grass seafood soup, chicken curry and vegetables with rice noodles. The festival is free; the food is $1 to $4.

A lecture about cheese, with a tasting, will be given by Steven Jenkins, Fairway's cheese buyer, at the store, 2127 Broadway (74th Street), next Wednesday from 7:30 to 9 p.m. The fee is $40. Reservations: (212) 595-1888.

A tasting of 10 Sauternes, including a 1950 Chateau Suduiraut and a 1959 La Tour Blanche, will be held on July 20 from 6:30 to 8 p.m. at the Honors Bridge Club, 115 East 57th Street. The event, sponsored by the New York branch of Tasters Guild International, is $110 for members, $125 for nonmembers; (212) 799-6311. A buffet supper will be served at 6 p.m., at $7 a person.

The grand finale of an intensive one-week chefs' course with Madeleine Kamman at Johnson and Wales University in Providence, R.I., will be a Bastille Day dinner. The menu, from 1789, might be one that Louis XVI and Marie Antoinette would have savored. The eight chefs who are taking the course, which begins next week, will decide the details, but there's bound to be brioche.

The dinner, on July 14, will start with a 6 p.m. Champagne reception and will be given in the Angelica Dining Room at the university's Harborside Campus, off Allens Avenue. The fee, $100, benefits the scholarship fund. Reservations: (401) 598-1807.
